decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The proposed extension, by reason of its size, design, massing, character and appearance is considered to be an over dominant and incongruous form of development which would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the existing dwelling and surrounding streetscene. The proposal would be therefore contrary to policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan 2021, Policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton's Sites and Polices Plan (2014) and Policy CS 14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011).
Reason : 2 - The proposed extension, by reason of its size, design, massing and position on the boundary is considered to cause a harmful impact on the amenity of the adjoining neighbouring properties through overlooking and loss of privacy (numbers 168 and 166 Cottenham Park Road) and have an overbearing impact (number 170 Cottenham Park Road). The proposal would be therefore contrary to policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan 2021, Policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton's Sites and Polices Plan (2014)
and Policy CS 14 of the Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011).
Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description: ERECTION OF TWO-STORY SIDE EXTENSION AND REAR DORMER EXTENSION.
